Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

East of the Aylorian Church Altar

the north is a large wooden door that leads out to the Templar's Road of
Andolar.  To the east is a small nook with golden curtains cascading from
ceiling to floor.  A large mithril throne stands in the middle of the room

and right fawn over him, cooing and giggling like school girls.

Misty Border
  The road you have been walking on has become clouded up ahead. A thick 
choking fog has descended and envelops it and you as well. The air is 
choking heavy with the moisture and a sickeningly sweet smell. You can't 
quite place your finger on it. As you turn your head to look about, you find 
that the way back has become obscured. The only things you can make out 
clearly are the road under your feet and the soft glow of the light above
you...

[ Exits: north down ]

                     Goal information for: Tilule Rehabilitation Clinic 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Things are not as they seem at the Tilule Rehabilitation Clinic. The owner of
the clinic, Tilule, needs your help completing various tasks to help clean up
the clinic and ensure it continues running for many years to come. If you are
up to the challenge, find the owner on the third floor of the clinic. He will
be happy to accept any help that comes his way.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Difficulty       : Medium              
Recommended Level:  75
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You have not yet unlocked any of the tasks in this quest.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Entering the second level
  You have entered the second level of the clinic. This level houses the 
patients who are recovering and need a place to stay while their medications 
take affect and their wounds heal. You see the occasional nurse walk by, 
checking on them to make sure they don't need anything. A hallway stretches 
east and west and two doors lie to the north and south. The doors have a 
small sign labeled "Restrooms". There's also a stairwell here leading down to
the first floor and upwards to the third floor of the clinic.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

game.)

adventurers.

The triage area (2052)

The triage area
  You have entered the medical triage center of the clinic. Here, patients are 
evaluated to determine the criticality of their wounds or injuries. From 
here, they are directed to one of the other areas of the clinic to receive 
treatment. Like the rest of the clinic, this room is at maximum capacity.
The personnel is in a rush to get people diagnosed and on to the correct 
treatment room. The exit from the triage area is through the doorway to the 
south, while the rest of the triage room continues east and north.

[ Exits: north east south ]
     (Magic) A small pile of cotton wraps has been dropped here.
     (Magic) A medical bed stands in the center of the room.
(Red Aura) A lab assistant stands here, bleeding from the face.
A triage doctor is here, inspecting the wounded patients.
(Red Aura) A wounded jotun is here, sitting on the medical bed.

  Two different hallways come to an intersection here. Due to the sufficient 
lighting, you can see nearly to the end of each hallway. A janitor or a 
doctor occasionally passes by, on their way to an unknown destination. The 
noises here are loud, since the intersection funnels them to this single

help locate object
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Locate Object'.
Help Category : Detection.
Related Helps : Locate corpse, Findcorpse.
Last Updated  : 2014-04-10 18:17:31.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax: cast 'locate object' <keyword>

This spell reveals the location of visible objects with the given keyword,
based on the player's current level.  

Items that have been concealed by a thief and some other powerful magical 
objects will remain undetected.

The location column is color coded:

  Red      - Item is on a player.
  Cyan     - Item is on a mobile.
  Green    - Item is on the ground in a room.

Stats have no affect on the locate object spell once it has been 
successfully cast.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  3585/4086 MP  2054/2054 mv  669tnl  
Lv 131  G 161560 | The janitor's closet (W)

  The foyer of this patient room is a bit darker than the others. Perhaps the

"run w2n"
run w2n
A bright hallway (2049)

A bright hallway (2048)

An intersection of hallways
  Two different hallways come to an intersection here. Due to the sufficient 
lighting, you can see nearly to the end of each hallway. A janitor or a 
doctor occasionally passes by, on their way to an unknown destination. The 
noises here are loud, since the intersection funnels them to this single 
point. The hallways continue in all directions. There is a small door in the 
floor beneath your feet, and a stairwell that leads upwards to the second 
floor of the clinic.

[ Exits: north east south west up (down) ]
     (Magic) A first floor directory has been posted on the wall.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  3828/4086 MP  2051/2054 mv  661tnl  
Lv 131  G 161776 | Patient Room 4 (N)
>>    
help empty
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Fill Empty Pour.
Help Category : Equipment.
Related Helps : Drink.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-16 21:35:32.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: fill <container> (<drink source>)
        pour <container> 

By itself, 'fill <container>' will refill a drink container with the first
in-room liquid source available (a fountain, barrel, pitcher, etc.).  If
the drink container in your inventory is not completely empty, you can
create a cocktail mix by filling it with a different liquid type. You may
also use 'fill <container> <source>' to fill from a specific source when
there is more than one in the room.

To empty a container, either 'pour <container>' or 'empty <container>'.

There is also a video which shows how to manipulate drink containers on 
Aardwolf:

                         http://youtu.be/iDTRwBrS6a0


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  3828/4086 MP  2051/2054 mv  661tnl

>>    
Entering the second level
  You have entered the second level of the clinic. This level houses the 
patients who are recovering and need a place to stay while their medications 
take affect and their wounds heal. You see the occasional nurse walk by, 
checking on them to make sure they don't need anything. A hallway stretches 
east and west and two doors lie to the north and south. The doors have a 
small sign labeled "Restrooms". There's also a stairwell here leading down to
the first floor and upwards to the third floor of the clinic.

[ Exits: (north) east (south) west up down ]
     (Vibrant) A pair of greaves, made of hardened leather, protect the lower legs.
     (Glow) (Hum) People always said the Boss had an iron fist.
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A jagged piece of metal embedded in a headpiece lies here.
     (Magic) (Polished) A used mining pick has been left here.
     A pass allowing access to the slave quarters is here.
     (Magic) A second floor directory has been posted on the wall.
     (Magic) A chalkboard hangs on the southern wall.
A nurse checks on the patients to make sure they are healing properly.

take affect and their wounds heal. You see the occasional nurse walk by,

east and west and two doors lie to the north and south. The doors have a 
small sign labeled "Restrooms". There's also a stairwell here leading down to
the first floor and upwards to the third floor of the clinic.

the western wall, one against the eastern wall and the last against the 
northern wall. There is barely enough room here for three beds, and the

area. The only exit is to the south.

Patient Room 7
  Looking around the patient room, you notice three beds: one stands against 
the western wall, one against the eastern wall and the last against the 
northern wall. There is barely enough room here for three beds, and the 
clinic owners are considering adding another to each room! Sure, they need 
more room for patients, but that many people would not fit into this small 
room. The only exit is to the south.

Entering the second level
  You have entered the second level of the clinic. This level houses the 
patients who are recovering and need a place to stay while their medications 
take affect and their wounds heal. You see the occasional nurse walk by, 
checking on them to make sure they don't need anything. A hallway stretches 
east and west and two doors lie to the north and south. The doors have a 
small sign labeled "Restrooms". There's also a stairwell here leading down to
the first floor and upwards to the third floor of the clinic.

An intersection of hallways
  Two different hallways come to an intersection here. Due to the sufficient 
lighting, you can see nearly to the end of each hallway. A janitor or a 
doctor occasionally passes by, on their way to an unknown destination. The 
noises here are loud, since the intersection funnels them to this single 
point. The hallways continue in all directions. There is a small door in the 
floor beneath your feet, and a stairwell that leads upwards to the second 
floor of the clinic.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

>>    Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

the front desk. An old man with one eye stares at you. Better make it quick

punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  4086/4086 MP  2046/2054 mv  655tnl

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Approaching a large clinic
  You are standing before a large building to the north. It appears to have 
been carefully constructed with large bricks and steel on the corners.
Perhaps the builders had in mind that this establishment must withstand some 
significant weather events. Occasionally, people rush by, heading towards the
building. The exits west, east and south head back to the continent of 
Mesolar.

Standing before double doors
  To the north lies a large, brick building. A pair of large, glass double 
doors are the main entryway into the building. The sign hanging above the 
double doors reads "Tilule Rehabilitation Clinic", and clearly indicates the 
purpose for the structure. The exit to the south leads back to the world of 
Andolor.

>>    An intersection of hallways
  Two different hallways come to an intersection here. Due to the sufficient 
lighting, you can see nearly to the end of each hallway. A janitor or a 
doctor occasionally passes by, on their way to an unknown destination. The 
noises here are loud, since the intersection funnels them to this single 
point. The hallways continue in all directions. There is a small door in the 
floor beneath your feet, and a stairwell that leads upwards to the second 
floor of the clinic.

n
A bright hallway
  This bright hallway continues north and south. The lighting here seems even 
brighter than in the rest of the clinic hallways. You assume it is kept so 
well lit here to enable the janitors to spot unclean areas and for easy 
access to the various rooms of the clinic. To the north is an intersection 
and this hallway continues to the south.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  4086/4086 MP  2053/2054 mv  655tnl (Reply: Dar) 
Lv 131  G 182380 | A bright hallway (NS)
>>    
n


An intersection of hallways
  Two different hallways come to an intersection here. Due to the sufficient 
lighting, you can see nearly to the end of each hallway. A janitor or a 
doctor occasionally passes by, on their way to an unknown destination. The 
noises here are loud, since the intersection funnels them to this single 
point. The hallways continue in all directions. There is a small door in the 
floor beneath your feet, and a stairwell that leads upwards to the second 
floor of the clinic.

[ Exits: north east south west up (down) ]
     (Magic) A first floor directory has been posted on the wall.
A clinical janitor ensures the hallways remain spotless and shiny.
This clinical nurse makes sure everything is kept in stock.

e
A flickering hallway
  You have entered a hallway that is not as bright as the rest. There is a 
light hanging above that needs changing; it is flickering very rapidly. It 
makes you dizzy as you try to navigate through the clinic. You consider 
letting a janitor know the lights need to be replaced, but it would be 
impossible for them not to know this already. There's a small door to the 
south with a sign labeling the room as "Major Surgeries".

[ Exits: east (south) west ]

Lv 131  G 182380 | An intersection of hallways (NESWU[D])
>>    Entering the second level
  You have entered the second level of the clinic. This level houses the 
patients who are recovering and need a place to stay while their medications 
take affect and their wounds heal. You see the occasional nurse walk by, 
checking on them to make sure they don't need anything. A hallway stretches 
east and west and two doors lie to the north and south. The doors have a 
small sign labeled "Restrooms". There's also a stairwell here leading down to
the first floor and upwards to the third floor of the clinic.

     (Vibrant) A pair of greaves, made of hardened leather, protect the lower legs.

the first floor and upwards to the third floor of the clinic.

shelp clap

Social output for clap.
<1> - You clap your hands together.
<2> - <player> shows <his/her/their> approval by clapping <his/her/their> hands together.
<3> - You clap at <his/her/their> performance.
<4> - <player> claps at <target's> performance.
<5> - <player> claps at your performance.
<6> - You clap at your own performance.
<7> - <player> claps at <his/her/their> own performance.
Usage this reboot : 1356 53 (player/mob)
Created by        : Unknown

Line numbers correspond to those listed in 'HELP NEW SOCIAL'.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (White Aura) (OPK) Spublofe is always half AFK.
(Player) (Golden Aura) Ruo the Elementalist.

(Player) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) (OPK) Lexicon the Navigator.
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Tavrin is here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

help goals
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Goals.
Help Category : Information.
Related Helps : Area Quests, Goal solving, Quests, Tasks.
Last Updated  : 2010-06-25 22:14:27.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax: goals                         : List all non-hidden goals.
        goals <goal/search text>      : Lists information for given goal.
        goals here                    : Lists current area goal info.
        goals <sort option(s)> <text> : Lists all goals matching search.
        goals stats <option(s)>       : Show global opened/completed stats.
        goals <playername>            : Show player goal list. (Imm-only)

Many areas have goals.  These goals are made up of several steps, or tasks;
these tasks can vary from simply giving a response to
finding a particular item to killing multiple enemies of the task-giver.
Often times, goals include small rewards as you progress as well as special
bonuses for completing the entire goal.

Type 'goals' by itself to see a list of all goals.  'goals <goal name>' will
give more information on the specific goal, and 'goals here' will give goal
information on the current area.  'goals <search text>' lists all goals
with the given search text in the goal name or description.

Several other options can also be combined with 'goals' searches:

  <level range> : Lists all goals from minimum level to optional max level.
  new           : Lists goals you have not started.
  open          : Lists all goals you have started.
  notdone       : Lists goals that you have not completed.
  completed     : Lists all goals you have completed.
  byname        : Sorts goal output alphabetically rather than by level.
  byrating      : Sorts goals by difficulty rating instead of level.

These options may be combined, e.g., 'goals 15 50 new hero' or 'goals 150
open byrating'.

'goals stats' displays how many players have started and completed each
listed goal.  You may use the sort options 'bytaken' and 'bydone' (as well
as normal sort options) to change how these results are displayed.

Immortals may see a player's goal listing by typing 'goals <playername>'.


Goals generally have several tasks as part of their completion progress.
See 'help tasks' for more information on how to see these tasks. See 'help
goal solving' for general advice on solving goals, and 'help <goal name>'
for some additional information on the area and its task.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  4086/4086 MP  2054/2054 mv  637tnl (Reply: Dar) 
Lv 131  G 184338 | Medical lounge (E[D])

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Misty Border
  The road you have been walking on has become clouded up ahead. A thick 
choking fog has descended and envelops it and you as well. The air is 
choking heavy with the moisture and a sickeningly sweet smell. You can't 
quite place your finger on it. As you turn your head to look about, you find 
that the way back has become obscured. The only things you can make out 
clearly are the road under your feet and the soft glow of the light above
you...

[ Exits: north down ]

Fork in the Path
  The mist has begun to lift, letting you see how far you have travelled.
Either you are wearing seven league boots, or you have been in a daze, 
because the countryside that you can see through the mist does not appear the
same as that which you left. It is growing cold. You had best seek shelter 
soon. To the east, a country road appears to meander through farmers' fields.
To the north, the path rises gently upwards.

A Road through the Fields
  The road passes through fertile farmlands to the north and south. The route 
itself is in good repair, but for some minor ruts caused by heavily laden 
wagons heading towards the populated parts of the region. Once in a while you
pass other travelers, who, for the most part, are heading east.

A Road through the Forest
  The wheat fields are mostly behind you, and ahead, the road continues.

wheat for the seeds. Scarecrows are needed, but none are seen. It is rather

e
A Road through the Countryside
  The road runs along a series of farmers' homes. They are built of logs of 
wood, cleverly linked at the corners by a sort of key- lock arrangement. The 
roofs are made of shiny tin, and are steeply sloping. A few have dormer 
windows from which the hausfraus peer, watching the world go by.

[ Exits: east west ]
A farmer is resting after a hard day in the fields.
(Red Aura) A soldier is here, walking along the road.

A Road through the Countryside
  As you travel along the road, you admire the neat and tidy farmer's cottages 
bordering on the north and south sides. They are all similarly built of stone
and mortar with brightly painted doors and thatched roofs. Occasionally a 
child opens a door and runs out to the road, to meet up with a friend.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  3191/4086 MP  2054/2054 mv  637tnl (Reply: Dar)

e
A Road through the Countryside
  Cottages line the road to the north and south. They are small but very tidy 
and in excellent repair, judging by the fresh thatch on the roofs. Each 
cottage has a brightly painted door, representing the only real difference 
among them. Perhaps the farmers, after a long day of toil in the fields and a
few pints of ale afterwards, use the door color as their guide to finding 
home.

[ Exits: east west ]

Inside the Castle
  Tapestries cover the walls of the castle. They are old and faded, with 
moth-eaten holes in spots. However, despite their obvious age and 
debilitation, they evoke a sense of past grandeur and a long history.

A Darkening Path Turns
  The path through the forest turns to the east here, leading steeply up a 
cliff side. High above, a castle looms. Its many battlements seem to signify 
struggles against numerous enemies. The castle stands unmarred and 
impregnable.

Before a Castle Wall
  The castle battlements loom immediately to the north. Along the wall, peasant
hovels lean. There, pens of animals and small gardens grow. A peasant pokes 
his head out of one of the hovel doors, but quickly retreats. Visitors are 
few, and viewed with suspicion, it would appear. However, the castle gates 
are open, indicating the times are quite peaceful, or so it would seem.

The Main Hall
  The main hall of Tzar Vislav's castle is grand, but austere. The floor and 
walls are unadorned but for a frayed red carpet. The feast tables are solid 
oak, hewn roughly with no sign of artful invention. They are utilitarian, 
solid, and with many cuts from daggers left embedded in the tabletop, ready 
to slice meat or foe.

Fork in the Path
  The mist has begun to lift, letting you see how far you have travelled.
Either you are wearing seven league boots, or you have been in a daze, 
because the countryside that you can see through the mist does not appear the
same as that which you left. It is growing cold. You had best seek shelter 
soon. To the east, a country road appears to meander through farmers' fields.
To the north, the path rises gently upwards.

[ Exits: north east south ]
A farmer is resting after a hard day in the fields.
A wanderer of the land is playing his fiddle here.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3152/3478 HP  2616/4086 MP  2044/2054 mv  627tnl (Reply: Dar) 
Lv 131  G 185166 | Fork in the Path (NES)
>>    
s
Misty Border
  The road you have been walking on has become clouded up ahead. A thick 
choking fog has descended and envelops it and you as well. The air is 
choking heavy with the moisture and a sickeningly sweet smell. You can't 
quite place your finger on it. As you turn your head to look about, you find 
that the way back has become obscured. The only things you can make out 
clearly are the road under your feet and the soft glow of the light above
you...

[ Exits: north down ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3152/3478 HP  2616/4086 MP  2043/2054 mv  627tnl (Reply: Dar)

>>    
d
Mist-Shrouded Moorland
  The air is still, and an enshrouding mist roils thickly at the foot of
the Veashire Downs, tricking eyes into seeing things that are not there. 
Weak rays of sunlight barely penetrate the mist to reach the yellowing
grasses below.  

[ Exits: north east south west up ]

Fork in the Path
  The mist has begun to lift, letting you see how far you have travelled.
Either you are wearing seven league boots, or you have been in a daze, 
because the countryside that you can see through the mist does not appear the
same as that which you left. It is growing cold. You had best seek shelter 
soon. To the east, a country road appears to meander through farmers' fields.
To the north, the path rises gently upwards.

[ Exits: north east south ]
A farmer is resting after a hard day in the fields.
A wanderer of the land is playing his fiddle here.

A Road through the Fields
  This road bears little resemblance to the road you were just travelling
on.  It is far wider and looks well used by a great number of people,
horses, carts, just about everything.  Maybe the locals have been doing some
repair work since you have been gone.

>>    A Road through the Forest
  The wheat fields are mostly behind you, and ahead, the road continues.
Overhead, crows caw with delight - they appear to be anxious to attack the 
wheat for the seeds. Scarecrows are needed, but none are seen. It is rather 
surprising that not a soul can be seen in the fields, monitoring the growth 
and shooing the crows away.

>>    A Road through the Countryside
  The road runs along a series of farmers' homes. They are built of logs of 
wood, cleverly linked at the corners by a sort of key- lock arrangement. The 
roofs are made of shiny tin, and are steeply sloping. A few have dormer 
windows from which the hausfraus peer, watching the world go by.

[ Exits: east west ]
A farmer is resting after a hard day in the fields.

A Road through the Countryside
  As you travel along the road, you admire the neat and tidy farmer's cottages 
bordering on the north and south sides. They are all similarly built of stone
and mortar with brightly painted doors and thatched roofs. Occasionally a 
child opens a door and runs out to the road, to meet up with a friend.

[ Exits: east west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3152/3478 HP  2616/4086 MP  2039/2054 mv  627tnl (Reply: Dar) 
Lv 131  G 185166 | A Road through the Countryside (EW)
e
>>    
e
A Road through the Countryside
  Cottages line the road to the north and south. They are small but very tidy 
and in excellent repair, judging by the fresh thatch on the roofs. Each 
cottage has a brightly painted door, representing the only real difference 
among them. Perhaps the farmers, after a long day of toil in the fields and a
few pints of ale afterwards, use the door color as their guide to finding 
home.

[ Exits: east west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3152/3478 HP  2616/4086 MP  2039/2054 mv  627tnl (Reply: Dar)

turns northwards up ahead. The wheat fields are nearly behind you, and have 
been replaced by fallow land. In the distance, a plow horse, resting from a 
day's work, grazes lazily.

Fork in the Path (2006)

Misty Border
  The road you have been walking on has become clouded up ahead. A thick 
choking fog has descended and envelops it and you as well. The air is 
choking heavy with the moisture and a sickeningly sweet smell. You can't 
quite place your finger on it. As you turn your head to look about, you find 
that the way back has become obscured. The only things you can make out 
clearly are the road under your feet and the soft glow of the light above
you...

[ Exits: north down ]

The Main Hall
  The main hall of Tzar Vislav's castle is grand, but austere. The floor and 
walls are unadorned but for a frayed red carpet. The feast tables are solid 
oak, hewn roughly with no sign of artful invention. They are utilitarian, 
solid, and with many cuts from daggers left embedded in the tabletop, ready 
to slice meat or foe.

[ Exits: east ]
A crow is here, nibbling at seeds.

Before the Moat (2032)

The Moat Bridge
  You stand on a wide drawbridge leading from the road to a small castle to the
west. The bridge crosses a muddy moat, and looks as if it hasn't been drawn 
up in many decades. The chains connecting the bridge to the castle are rather
rusty in fact.

[ Exits: north east south (west) ]

Sentry Post
  The sentry post is a slightly elevated tower that stands over the moat.
Here, a few men of the king will gather and if not on duty, sometimes will 
play at cards or dice to while away the time. During peaceful times, it is 
not uncommon to have quite a big tournament, where the losers are thrown into
the moat with much laughter among the men.

[ Exits: south ]

(Red Aura) A sentry stands here, watching the road.

The Moat Bridge
  You stand on a wide drawbridge leading from the road to a small castle to the
west. The bridge crosses a muddy moat, and looks as if it hasn't been drawn 
up in many decades. The chains connecting the bridge to the castle are rather
rusty in fact.

Throne room of the Thrice Tenth Kingdom

kept. It appears to be the oldest castle in the land, and judging by the name
of the kingdom, has been in existence for perhaps 30 generations. The king

stole most of the lands of the Thrice Tenth Kingdom several hundred years 
ago, and although weakened, the King remains prideful.

  You stand on a wide drawbridge leading from the road to a small castle to the

up in many decades. The chains connecting the bridge to the castle are rather
rusty in fact.

The Castle Courtyard
  You stand in the courtyard, within the castle walls. There is a hustle and 
bustle all around you, as the residents of the castle go about their daily 
chores. Looking about, you can see the tops of apple trees growing beyond the
orchard gates. The entrance to the main hall of the castle is to the west.

  The drab grey stone of the castle almost absorbs the light from the torches.
The sounds of the soldiers grow nearer. Looking down you can see a dark red 
stain on the stone floor. It might be a fresh stain or might be old, as old 
as the castle itself. In the many hundreds of years since the castle was 
first constructed, there must have been much intrigue and even murder in 
these halls.

[ Exits: north east ]

Approaching a Castle (2036)

Before a Castle Wall
  The castle battlements loom immediately to the north. Along the wall, peasant
hovels lean. There, pens of animals and small gardens grow. A peasant pokes 
his head out of one of the hovel doors, but quickly retreats. Visitors are 
few, and viewed with suspicion, it would appear. However, the castle gates 
are open, indicating the times are quite peaceful, or so it would seem.

[ Exits: north south ]
You have 1 tell waiting. Type 'replay' to see it.

w
The Main Hall
  The main hall of Tzar Vislav's castle is grand, but austere. The floor and 
walls are unadorned but for a frayed red carpet. The feast tables are solid 
oak, hewn roughly with no sign of artful invention. They are utilitarian, 
solid, and with many cuts from daggers left embedded in the tabletop, ready 
to slice meat or foe.

>>    
The Castle Courtyard
  You stand in the courtyard, within the castle walls. There is a hustle and 
bustle all around you, as the residents of the castle go about their daily 
chores. Looking about, you can see the tops of apple trees growing beyond the
orchard gates. The entrance to the main hall of the castle is to the west.

>>    Before a Castle Wall

few, and viewed with suspicion, it would appear. However, the castle gates 
are open, indicating the times are quite peaceful, or so it would seem.

To the north, the path rises gently upwards.

A Road through the Forest

e
A Road through the Countryside
  The road runs along a series of farmers' homes. They are built of logs of 
wood, cleverly linked at the corners by a sort of key- lock arrangement. The 
roofs are made of shiny tin, and are steeply sloping. A few have dormer 
windows from which the hausfraus peer, watching the world go by.

[ Exits: east west ]

A Road through the Countryside

bordering on the north and south sides. They are all similarly built of stone

child opens a door and runs out to the road, to meet up with a friend.

e
A Road through the Countryside
  Cottages line the road to the north and south. They are small but very tidy 
and in excellent repair, judging by the fresh thatch on the roofs. Each 
cottage has a brightly painted door, representing the only real difference 
among them. Perhaps the farmers, after a long day of toil in the fields and a
few pints of ale afterwards, use the door color as their guide to finding 
home.

[ Exits: east west ]

The Throne of the Tzar
  This is the throne room of Tzar Afron. It is an ornate room, and spacious.
At the center, mounted on a platform, is an ornate chair. Upon it sits a man 
of obvious importance. Members of the court show great deference to this man,
and tend to cluster at the edges of the room.

  Here the road leading north and south crosses with one leading east and west.

rolling hills are low enough that you can make out each castle clearly. It is
hard to tell how distant each is, but given the quality of the road, it might
be less than a few hours walk to each.

Throne room of the Thrice Tenth Kingdom
  The Castle of the Thrice Tenth Kingdom is surprisingly small, but very nicely
kept. It appears to be the oldest castle in the land, and judging by the name
of the kingdom, has been in existence for perhaps 30 generations. The king 
looks with disdain upon the upstart tzars of the neighboring lands. They 
stole most of the lands of the Thrice Tenth Kingdom several hundred years 
ago, and although weakened, the King remains prideful.

Suddenly the wolf stands on its hind legs, and as you watch in amazement, he turns into the spitting
image of Elena, his fur turning into a dress, and his ears into long flowing locks of hair.
Princess Elena says, "Now you must take Yuli to Afron.  He will hopefully
 be fooled long enough to give you the horse.  Come back to me, with the
 horse, and we will wait for Yuli to escape."

Elena the wolf starts to follow you.
Princess Elena exclaims, "Now go, quickly, before the magic wears off!"

Inside the Castle
  Tapestries cover the walls of the castle. They are old and faded, with 
moth-eaten holes in spots. However, despite their obvious age and 
debilitation, they evoke a sense of past grandeur and a long history.

The Main Hall (2016)

The firebird flies in from the east.
The Main Hall
  The main hall of Tzar Vislav's castle is grand, but austere. The floor and 
walls are unadorned but for a frayed red carpet. The feast tables are solid 
oak, hewn roughly with no sign of artful invention. They are utilitarian, 
solid, and with many cuts from daggers left embedded in the tabletop, ready 
to slice meat or foe.

[ Exits: east ]
A field hand is here, trying to earn a living.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.
You have 1 tell waiting. Type 'replay' to see it.

s
d
Courtyard (G)
  It stinks.  The smell of sweat, tears and broken spirits fills the air.
The sounds of soldiers in training have gotten much louder as you step
into the courtyard. "I don't know but I've been told, it's hard to run
with the weight of gold." You see soldiers everywhere running laps on
a beaten path around the courtyard. Some less-fortunate soldiers are lined
up doing pushups in the mud. In the center of the courtyard lay a finely 
manicured lawn and the Boot clan flag. To the north you notice the bunk 
house, to the west the General's quarters. Suddenly, an officer grabs you 
by the shoulder and shouts "What are you gawking around for, future
soldier? It's time you enlisted!" And with that he points you east to 
the enlisting office.

[ Exits: north east ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2672/3478 HP  3120/4086 MP  2053/2054 mv  581tnl (Reply: Dar) 
Lv 131  G 170606 | Courtyard (NE)

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2703/3478 HP  3199/4086 MP  2052/2054 mv  581tnl (Reply: Dar)

w
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]

wake
You wake up on Medical beds, then stand up.
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) (OPK) Breathe in, Breathe out..

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Before Castle Levitus
  To the north, the swirling clouds part somewhat to reveal a structure of
immense proportions rising from a jagged island of solid rock which hangs
suspended by some mystical force.  Imposing stone walls, jet black in hue,
are topped by numerous crenellated towers.  One in particular overshadows
the rest, its lofty height dwarfing its peers.  The pinnacle of the great
tower is obscured by a mist which seems to pulse and coagulate as if with a
life of its own.  Intermittent glimmers of light slip from within the dark
fortress merely serving to cast the grim stonework into deeper shadow.  

[ Exits: north east south west down ]

A sweltering, gentle breeze blows from the northeast.

d
A Desolate Bog
  A dank chill permeates the air, cutting through clothing.  The occasional
gust of wind keeps the mist flowing constantly about the wilted trees and
reeds.  The ground under foot is muddy and water-logged, making passage a
wearisome task for any passing this way.  Occasionally a fleeting form may
be glimpsed in the banks of fog, only to vanish from sight as quickly as it
appeared.

[ Exits: north east west ]

A Desolate Bog
  A dank chill permeates the air, cutting through clothing.  The occasional
gust of wind keeps the mist flowing constantly about the wilted trees and
reeds.  The ground under foot is muddy and water-logged, making passage a
wearisome task for any passing this way.  Occasionally a fleeting form may
be glimpsed in the banks of fog, only to vanish from sight as quickly as it
appeared.

[ Exits: north east west ]

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some

Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

A Small Well...
  To the rear of the farm lies a small well.  It is in obvious disrepair,
the rope to the bucket frayed, the masonry crumbling, and the bucket having a
small hole in its side.  To the side of the well are a couple large
wheelbarrows, which contain water pulled from the well.  

[ Exits: south down ]

(Golden Aura) An indescribably cute kitten plays with a ball of string here.

d
At The Bottom Of The Well
  After lowering yourself down the well for what seems to be an eternity,
you finally reach the bottom of the well.  As you let go of the rope and
land on the well floor, you can see that Sarah was right, the well is bone
dry.  As you look around, you can see many small holes in the wall of the
well.  Perhaps these are where the water came from.  To the east, is a small
boulder, which appears to be blocking the way of a rather large hole.  

[ Exits: (east) up ]
A centipede is crawling along the floor, looking for its next meal.
A centipede is crawling along the floor, looking for its next meal.

>>    Searching the Caverns... [**> PK <**]
  Dank and dark are these caves. You notice that water sheets down the wall in 
some areas of this cave, giving the cavern an almost mirror-like surface. As 
you venture forward, you come across a corpse of a Elf, hacked to bits and 
half eaten by the insects that inhabit the caverns. Perhaps this would be a 
good time to find your way out of here...

[ Exits: east south west ]

some areas of this cave, giving the cavern an almost mirror-like surface. As

>>    The N'Kari Pit
  As you step through the door, you suddenly find yourself standing on a

pit.  As you peer around the room you find several dark elves leaning over
the railing watching a large beast dismember an unfortunate elf.  With one
great blow, the beast cleaves the elf in two, and a great cheer rises up
from the dark elves.  The dark elves then go back to betting on how long the
next victim will last.

A Large Library
  The shelves of the library hold many different types of books and are
quite tall, easily reaching a height of two or three stories.  To the west,
the books seem to contain knowledge of battle.  To the south, a book of
spells.  Each side of the library also has a large wooden door, and you
can't help but feel that what is behind the door will rely on the knowledge
learnt from the books that surround it.

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Where Is Thalien?

Sarah exclaims, "Shortly after he went into the well, I heard him yell, and 
when I looked down I saw some robed people carrying him through a doorway 
behind a large boulder!" 

Sarah exclaims, "I tried to follow them, but the doorway closed before I could 
go any farther, and the noises I heard beyond the door frightened me!" 

Sarah says, "I need you to go in there, rescue Thalien, and see what those 
robed people are doing." 

Sarah says, "He might be too scared to believe you, so if you give him the 
flowers in the well, then he will know that you are on his side." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The Mess Hall
  The mess hall could not have been more appropriately named, as the soldiers 
break furniture, throw food, and brawl over petty arguments. As the officers 
enter the room and sit to eat, the rabble dies down. The soldiers are hoping 
that the officers won't cut their supply of wine off.

The Slaughterhouse
   As you enter the butcher shop, the smell of dried blood fills your
nostrils.  As you peer over the counter, you can see legs, heads, and torsos
of various animals hanging from large hooks.  To the left, there are several
wicker baskets that hold the various organ meats that are for sale.  A
rather large man walks into the room, and tosses a liver towards the basket.
However, he misses and it falls on the floor.  "Half Price on that one,"  he
says to you.

The Bell Tower
  As you continue along the roof, you come across a crudely built bell tower.
It appears to have been added after construction of the temple, as it is in 
stark contrast with the quality of work used to create the temple. Most of 
the wood is aged and rotting, and has been patched over again and again with 
fresh planks of wood.

[ Exits: east up ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3067/3507 HP  552/4121 MP  2074/2074 mv  697tnl (Reply: Dar) 
Lv 132  G 268813 | The Bell Tower (EU)

u
Top of the Bell Tower
  The bell that once had a home here no longer hangs here, as the poorly 
constructed girder and frayed ropes used by the army have snapped under the 
weight of the bell some time ago. When the bell fell, it took out most of the
tower, and the monks attempted to repair the damage by placing wooden planks 
down randomly. As the wind picks up, the tower starts to rock slightly, 
giving you quite an uneasy feeling...

The Altar of Sacrifice
  The altar of sacrifice looks like a rather large bowl, with a small hole
in the center.  The inside of the stone altar has been stained crimson, from
the constant flow of blood.  As the blessed leads the ceremony, the
initiates place their wrists over the altar, and the blessed slits their
wrists.  The blood flows, and is collected in a bowl under the altar.  

[ Exits: east west ]

The Altar of Pleasure (G)
  The altar of pleasure holds many depictions of what pleasures the
initates can take part in.  Praying, eating, sleeping, worshipping,

w
The Altar of Sacrifice
  The altar of sacrifice looks like a rather large bowl, with a small hole
in the center.  The inside of the stone altar has been stained crimson, from
the constant flow of blood.  As the blessed leads the ceremony, the
initiates place their wrists over the altar, and the blessed slits their
wrists.  The blood flows, and is collected in a bowl under the altar.  

[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) An initiate of Zyian kneels here, praying to him.
(Golden Aura) An initiate of Zyian kneels here, praying to him.

w
Initiate's Quarters
  The quarters reserved for the intitates are quite bare.  Each initiate
seems only to have a bed, and a small table which holds the ancient text
that they worship.  Those of the initiates who are not sleeping are praying. 
The faithful walk around the initiates here, correcting their posture when
kneeling, and leading in prayer.

A Long Corridor
  The corridor comes to an abrupt halt here.  At the end of the hall there
is a large carving in the wall.  It appears to be a depiction of a daemon,
drinking the blood of the monks who worship in this temple.  As you look at
the carving, you can start to hear a low moaning or chanting coming from
behind a large wooden door to the west.

>>    The Room of the Blessed
  The room for the blessed is much different from those of the intitates
and of the faithful.  Large beds lie here, books abound, and there are many
tables which hold food, drink, and cards.  Occasionally an initiate comes
in, to serve the blessed, but then leaves on his knees when dismissed.

A Stone Staircase
  In a small hall just off from the worship area, you find a small stone 
staircase. Just like the rest of the temple, the stairs are well crafted and 
have intricate designs carved into them. The stairs lead up, to what appears 
to be the roof.

>>    Before the Temple
  As you pass the trial, the southern door opens to you and leads you out
in front of this large temple.  It is carved almost entirely out of white
marble, and contains many beautifully crafted stained glass windows.  Many
are showing acts of love, friendship and mercy.  The doors to the cathedral
are very large, and made mostly out of wood.  They have long bands of iron,
which are nailed to the planks, keeping the door in one piece.

A Gravel Path (2074)

Before the Temple
  As you pass the trial, the southern door opens to you and leads you out
in front of this large temple.  It is carved almost entirely out of white
marble, and contains many beautifully crafted stained glass windows.  Many
are showing acts of love, friendship and mercy.  The doors to the cathedral
are very large, and made mostly out of wood.  They have long bands of iron,
which are nailed to the planks, keeping the door in one piece.

that they worship.  Those of the initiates who are not sleeping are praying.

>>    
Faithful's Quarters
  The faithful's quarters look much like the initates, except that their beds 
are spaced farther apart. The room is well carpeted and large prayer tables 
run along the centre. You notice that all the Faithful are women, possibly to
represent a "mother" to the initiates, allowing them to guide their prayers 
and thoughts.

[ Exits: down ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A tattered and well-used robe lies on the floor.

A Stone Staircase
  In a small hall just off from the worship area, you find a small stone 
staircase. Just like the rest of the temple, the stairs are well crafted and 
have intricate designs carved into them. The stairs lead up, to what appears 
to be the roof.

  As you walk along the roof, you come across a large stained glass window.

flames.  As you continue looking at it, you can see small hinges on parts of
the glass, possibly to gain access to repair the window if it cracks.

>>    The Bell Tower
  As you continue along the roof, you come across a crudely built bell tower.
It appears to have been added after construction of the temple, as it is in 
stark contrast with the quality of work used to create the temple. Most of 
the wood is aged and rotting, and has been patched over again and again with 
fresh planks of wood.

[ Exits: east up ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2055/3507 HP  306/4121 MP  2074/2074 mv  599tnl (Reply: Dar) 
Lv 132  G 272378 | The Bell Tower (EU)
u
>>    
Top of the Bell Tower
  The bell that once had a home here no longer hangs here, as the poorly 
constructed girder and frayed ropes used by the army have snapped under the 
weight of the bell some time ago. When the bell fell, it took out most of the
tower, and the monks attempted to repair the damage by placing wooden planks 
down randomly. As the wind picks up, the tower starts to rock slightly, 
giving you quite an uneasy feeling...

[ Exits: down ]

w
The Altar of Pleasure (G)
  The altar of pleasure holds many depictions of what pleasures the
initates can take part in.  Praying, eating, sleeping, worshipping,
sacrifice, and love are all depicted on this altar.  Long hours are spent
here by initates, faithful and blessed, seeking and finding solace for their
sacrifice.  

[ Exits: east south west ]

w
The Altar of Sacrifice
  The altar of sacrifice looks like a rather large bowl, with a small hole
in the center.  The inside of the stone altar has been stained crimson, from
the constant flow of blood.  As the blessed leads the ceremony, the
initiates place their wrists over the altar, and the blessed slits their
wrists.  The blood flows, and is collected in a bowl under the altar.  

[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) An initiate of Zyian kneels here, praying to him.

>>    Before the Temple
  As you pass the trial, the southern door opens to you and leads you out
in front of this large temple.  It is carved almost entirely out of white
marble, and contains many beautifully crafted stained glass windows.  Many
are showing acts of love, friendship and mercy.  The doors to the cathedral
are very large, and made mostly out of wood.  They have long bands of iron,
which are nailed to the planks, keeping the door in one piece.

A Gravel Path
  The gravel path branches off here. To the north is the mess hall, and it is 
filled with loud yelling, laughing and cursing. To the east are the barracks,
where the soldiers sleep. And to the west lies the temple.

The Mess Hall
  The mess hall could not have been more appropriately named, as the soldiers 
break furniture, throw food, and brawl over petty arguments. As the officers 
enter the room and sit to eat, the rabble dies down. The soldiers are hoping 
that the officers won't cut their supply of wine off.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

At The Bottom Of The Well
  After lowering yourself down the well for what seems to be an eternity,
you finally reach the bottom of the well.  As you let go of the rope and
land on the well floor, you can see that Sarah was right, the well is bone
dry.  As you look around, you can see many small holes in the wall of the
well.  Perhaps these are where the water came from.  To the east, is a small
boulder, which appears to be blocking the way of a rather large hole.  

[ Exits: (east) up ]

A Large Library
  The shelves of the library hold many different types of books and are
quite tall, easily reaching a height of two or three stories.  To the west,
the books seem to contain knowledge of battle.  To the south, a book of
spells.  Each side of the library also has a large wooden door, and you
can't help but feel that what is behind the door will rely on the knowledge
learnt from the books that surround it.  

[ Exits: north (south) (west) ]
(Invis) (Red Aura) Foulspawn, self proclaimed king of the imps, is sitting here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

adventurers.

At The Bottom Of The Well
  After lowering yourself down the well for what seems to be an eternity,
you finally reach the bottom of the well.  As you let go of the rope and
land on the well floor, you can see that Sarah was right, the well is bone
dry.  As you look around, you can see many small holes in the wall of the
well.  Perhaps these are where the water came from.  To the east, is a small
boulder, which appears to be blocking the way of a rather large hole.

tasks here

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Where Is Thalien?

Sarah exclaims, "Shortly after he went into the well, I heard him yell, and 
when I looked down I saw some robed people carrying him through a doorway 
behind a large boulder!" 

Sarah exclaims, "I tried to follow them, but the doorway closed before I could 
go any farther, and the noises I heard beyond the door frightened me!" 

Sarah says, "I need you to go in there, rescue Thalien, and see what those 
robed people are doing." 

Sarah says, "He might be too scared to believe you, so if you give him the 
flowers in the well, then he will know that you are on his side." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

The N'Kari Pit
  As you step through the door, you suddenly find yourself standing on a
steel grating that is suspended a good 20 feet above what appears to be a
pit.  As you peer around the room you find several dark elves leaning over
the railing watching a large beast dismember an unfortunate elf.  With one
great blow, the beast cleaves the elf in two, and a great cheer rises up
from the dark elves.  The dark elves then go back to betting on how long the
next victim will last.

At The Bottom Of The Well
  After lowering yourself down the well for what seems to be an eternity,
you finally reach the bottom of the well.  As you let go of the rope and
land on the well floor, you can see that Sarah was right, the well is bone
dry.  As you look around, you can see many small holes in the wall of the
well.  Perhaps these are where the water came from.  To the east, is a small
boulder, which appears to be blocking the way of a rather large hole.  

[ Exits: east up ]

The N'Kari Pit
  As you step through the door, you suddenly find yourself standing on a
steel grating that is suspended a good 20 feet above what appears to be a
pit.  As you peer around the room you find several dark elves leaning over
the railing watching a large beast dismember an unfortunate elf.  With one
great blow, the beast cleaves the elf in two, and a great cheer rises up
from the dark elves.  The dark elves then go back to betting on how long the
next victim will last.

tasks here

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Where Is Thalien?

Sarah exclaims, "Shortly after he went into the well, I heard him yell, and 
when I looked down I saw some robed people carrying him through a doorway 
behind a large boulder!" 

Sarah exclaims, "I tried to follow them, but the doorway closed before I could 
go any farther, and the noises I heard beyond the door frightened me!" 

Sarah says, "I need you to go in there, rescue Thalien, and see what those 
robed people are doing." 

Sarah says, "He might be too scared to believe you, so if you give him the 
flowers in the well, then he will know that you are on his side." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

help rescue
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Rescue.
Help Category : followers.
Related Helps : autoassist.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-30 19:10:14.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: rescue <target>

Amidst the fury of battle, you turn and find your comrade struggling under
the onslaught! Rather than allow them to be severely beaten, you jump between
your friend and their foe, rescuing them from further harm.

Success in rescuing depends on the skill rating, as well as a comparison of
level, dexterity, and speed between the character and the target. (Note- you
rescue a friend, not the monster.)

Primary stat: Dexterity
Affected by: Luck


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The N'Kari Pit
  As you step through the door, you suddenly find yourself standing on a
steel grating that is suspended a good 20 feet above what appears to be a
pit.  As you peer around the room you find several dark elves leaning over
the railing watching a large beast dismember an unfortunate elf.  With one
great blow, the beast cleaves the elf in two, and a great cheer rises up
from the dark elves.  The dark elves then go back to betting on how long the
next victim will last.

At The Bottom Of The Well
  After lowering yourself down the well for what seems to be an eternity,
you finally reach the bottom of the well.  As you let go of the rope and
land on the well floor, you can see that Sarah was right, the well is bone
dry.  As you look around, you can see many small holes in the wall of the
well.  Perhaps these are where the water came from.  To the east, is a small
boulder, which appears to be blocking the way of a rather large hole.

tasks here all

       Zyian : Discover What the Cult Under the Well Is Planning
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Where Is Thalien?

Sarah exclaims, "Shortly after he went into the well, I heard him yell, and 
when I looked down I saw some robed people carrying him through a doorway 
behind a large boulder!" 

Sarah exclaims, "I tried to follow them, but the doorway closed before I could 
go any farther, and the noises I heard beyond the door frightened me!" 

Sarah says, "I need you to go in there, rescue Thalien, and see what those 
robed people are doing." 

Sarah says, "He might be too scared to believe you, so if you give him the 
flowers in the well, then he will know that you are on his side." 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

The N'Kari Pit
  As you step through the door, you suddenly find yourself standing on a
steel grating that is suspended a good 20 feet above what appears to be a
pit.  As you peer around the room you find several dark elves leaning over
the railing watching a large beast dismember an unfortunate elf.  With one
great blow, the beast cleaves the elf in two, and a great cheer rises up
from the dark elves.  The dark elves then go back to betting on how long the
next victim will last.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

l;ex
Western Entrance - Starlight Way (G)
  You stand at an entrance to the Great City of Aylor.  To the east, much
of the city is obscured by the enormous number of people travelling the
streets.  In the distance, however, you can see eight silver spires
stretching to the heavens like silver daggers piercing the sky.  To the
northeast, the enormous Aylorian church steeple towers over the city.

To the west, the Western High Road stretches out as a guide through
the continent of Mesolar.  The wide world is open to any adventurers, 
travellers, or merchants willing to take their first steps into the world.

Two large sentry posts stand here guarding the entrance, an unwelcome
sight to invaders.  Manned by elves with bows, the towers are also patrolled
by large rocs that fly overhead.  Shiny metal men stand at the pass checking
credentials and allowing guests into the city.

[ Exits: east west ]

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

A Small Dirt Path
  This once large trail has now been reclaimed by the wild grass that grows
to either side of it.  Only cows keep the trail alive, by walking and
grazing.  The trail leads north to a small farm.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A cow stands here, chewing its cud.

Sarah's Farm
  The dirt path leads you to a cattle farm.  It is quite small, as it seems
to only have a one or two room cabin, and a small shed that holds about 6
cows.  A lone woman stands in the field, watching her cows and slowly
herding them into the shed to be milked.  

[ Exits: north east ]
     A small claw lies on the floor here.
A cow stands here, chewing its cud.
A cow stands here, chewing its cud.
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) Sarah sits here, watching her cows.
